definitions.definition: The thing, person, idea, quality, event, action , or time indicated or understood from context, especially if more remote geographically, temporally or mentally than one designated as " this ", or if expressing distinction.
examples: That ' s my car over there.
He went home, and after that I never saw him again.
‘Who's that ?’ ‘It’s me.’.

subdefinitions.definition: Used to refer to a noun phrase or statement just made.
examples: They're getting divorced. What do you think about that ?
that
They gave me the book about whales. That I've not yet read.
She asked me to lend him my tools. That I couldn't do.
I got fed up, and that to a great degree.

subdefinitions.definition: Used to emphatically affirm or deny a previous statement or question.
examples: The water is so cold! — That it is.
Would you like another piece of cake?  — That I would!
We think that you stole the tarts. — That I did not!

definitions.definition: In a relative clause , referring to a previously mentioned noun, as subject, direct object, indirect object, or object of a preposition ; which , who .
examples: I didn't see the car that hit me.
The CPR course that she took really came in handy.
The house that he lived in was old and dilapidated.
This is the person that swore at me. (sometimes proscribed)
(sometimes proscribed)
The poor cat, that had been trapped for three days, was freed this morning. ( non-restrictive use; sometimes proscribed; see usage notes)
( non-restrictive use; sometimes proscribed; see usage notes)

definitions.definition: Used in place of relative adverbs such as where or when ; often omitted.
examples: the place that [ = where or to which ] I went last year
the last time that [ = when ] I went to Europe

main_definition: ( demonstrative ) The thing, person, idea, quality, event, action , or time indicated or understood from context, especially if more remote geographically, temporally or mentally than one designated as " this ", or if expressing distinction. [from 9 c.]
secondary_definitions: ( relative , plural that ) In a relative clause , referring to a previously mentioned noun, as subject, direct object, indirect object, or object of a preposition ; which , who . [from 9 c.]
( relative , colloquial ) Used in place of relative adverbs such as where or when ; often omitted.
